issue.message: Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `toLowerCase(Locale)` instead. For strings meant to be internal use `Locale.ROOT`, otherwise `Locale.getDefault()`.
Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `toLowerCase(Locale)` instead. For strings meant to be internal use `Locale.ROOT`, otherwise `Locale.getDefault()`.
Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `toLowerCase(Locale)` instead. For strings meant to be internal use `Locale.ROOT`, otherwise `Locale.getDefault()`.

issue.message: "Introduction_Introduction" is not translated in "nb" (Norwegian Bokmål)
issue.errorLine1:
<string name="Introduction_Introduction">FindMyDevice (FMD) is an application that can help you find your phone when it gets lost.
It uses SMS (texting) to communicate and send commands from a second device so you can track your phone.
Just send a SMS message that contains the "fmd" command.
Please note that this application is still in beta.

 - Nulide</string>

issue.message: "Introduction_UpdatePermission" is not translated in "nb" (Norwegian Bokmål)
issue.errorLine1: <string name="Introduction_UpdatePermission">Some new permissions are needed.\nPlease check the following permissions in order to continue using this application, or change back to an older version.</string>

issue.message: "Permission_SMS" is not translated in "nb" (Norwegian Bokmål)
issue.errorLine1: <string name="Permission_SMS">In order to command the phone to do something, this application needs to be able to see your SMS messages. Your messages never leave your phone, and they are never used for anything except finding your phone.\nThis Permission is needed.</string>

issue.message: "Permission_CONTACTS" is not translated in "nb" (Norwegian Bokmål)
issue.errorLine1: <string name="Permission_CONTACTS">Not everybody is allowed to send commands to your phone, so you need to select some contacts who will be able to locate your device.\nThis permission is needed.</string>

issue.message: "Permission_GPS" is not translated in "nb" (Norwegian Bokmål)
issue.errorLine1: <string name="Permission_GPS">If you want to get the GPS coordinates from your phone, the application needs this permission. \nPlease also allow the application to locate your phone in the background.\nIf you don\'t give this permission, this functionality will not be activated.</string>

issue.message: "Permission_DND" is not translated in "nb" (Norwegian Bokmål)
issue.errorLine1: <string name="Permission_DND">You also can make your phone ring to help you locate it. When \"Do Not Disturb\" is active, it may be possible that the phone is muted.\nIf you don\'t give this permission, this functionality will not be activated.</string>

issue.message: "Permission_DEVICE_ADMIN" is not translated in "nb" (Norwegian Bokmål)
issue.errorLine1: <string name="Permission_DEVICE_ADMIN">If you want to lock or wipe your phone if it gets lost, this permission is needed.\nIf you don\'t give this permission, this functionality will not be activated.</string>

issue.message: "Permission_WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS" is not translated in "nb" (Norwegian Bokmål)
issue.errorLine1:
<string name="Permission_WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS">This application is capable of turning on location if you normally leave location off.
If it is off, "fmd locate" will not work.
In order to achieve this, the application needs a special permission that you have to grant using a computer.
If you don't give this permission, it's no problem.
You can still use this application.</string>

issue.message: "Permission_OVERLAY" is not translated in "nb" (Norwegian Bokmål)
issue.errorLine1: <string name="Permission_OVERLAY">When you remotely lock your device, this application can show a message on the lockscreen for whoever finds your phone.\nIf you don\'t give this permission, this functionality will not be activated.</string>

issue.errorLine1: <string name="Alert_First_time_fmdserver">Here you can configure the application to communicate with FMDserver. If you want to configure a different server than default, you can do so by changing the URL. If you press "register" you can register the application to the server. Afterwards you can enable the server functionality. If you do so, your phone will send you location data to the specified server. You can check your phone\'s location by entering the ID and the password on the page.</string>

BroadcastReceivers that declare an intent-filter for `SMS_DELIVER` or `SMS_RECEIVED` must ensure that the caller has the `BROADCAST_SMS` permission, otherwise it is possible for malicious actors to spoof intents
Exported receiver does not require permission

Do not place Android context classes in static fields; this is a memory leak
